Award.AwardTitle: 2017 INFORMS Applied Probability Society Conference; Evanston, Illinois; July 10-12, 2017

Division.LongName: Div Of Civil, Mechanical, & Manufact Inn

Award.AbstractNarration:
The objective of this conference is to bring together researchers and students working in the field of applied probability, addressing design and operation of systems that involve random phenomena. The conferences brings together researchers in engineering, statistics, mathematics, and computer science and covers a broad range of topics, from methodological (queuing theory, dynamic programming, Markov decision process, discrete event dynamic systems, point processes, large deviations, reliability) to applications (energy, healthcare, online services), This award will support the participation of graduate students who will become the next generation of leaders in the applied probability community.

This workshop will be held at Northwestern University in Evanston, Illinois, from July 10-12, 2017. It is organized by four leading researchers in applied probability and brings together intellectual leaders from a variety of fields. The workshop organizers have identified three plenary talks and 75 invited and contributed sessions. The participants will present and reflect upon emerging research in these areas and identify important directions for future research. The conference will be broadly promoted through major professional societies such as the Institute for Operations Research and the Management Sciences (INFORMS) and its Applied Probability Society (APS) and Manufacturing and Service Operations Management Society (MSOM).

POR.DRECONTENT:
The Applied Probability Society (APS) is a subdivision of the Institute for Operations Research and the Management Sciences (INFORMS). The Society is concerned with the applicationof probability theory to systems that involve random phenomena, for example, manufacturing, communication network, computer network, service, and financial systems. The society has approximately 400 members, including practitioners and researchers with background in business, engineering, statistics, mathematics, economics, computer science, and other applied sciences. The society holds a biennial meeting which covers a wide range of topics, ranging from the methodological-- queueing theory, simulation, stochastic static and dynamic optimization, matrix-analytic methods, and data-science--to the applied--energy, sustainability, healthcare and finance.

The $7,500 awarded by NSF were used tol support travel to the conference of 10 PhD students from US universities to the APS biennial conference, which was held July 10 to July 12, 2017 at Northwestern University in Evanston, IL. Support was offered to graduate students who couldn't be fully supported by their advisors or departments. Applicants were asked to provide a one-page letter explaining their interest in the conference and its relation to their research interests, together with a CV. They were also asked to have their advisor send a letter of recommendation, in which it was explained why s/he cannot support the student's participation in the conference. The organizing committee received 11 requests for support. One of those requrests was denied, because the student did not present in the conference, and his advisor did not send a letter of support. Each of the 10 supported students received the minimum between their requested amount, and $910.75.
